column1: '''Soronúmë''' was one of the constellations that [[Varda]] traced in the sky with the dews of [[Telperion]]
column2: before the [[Awakening of the Elves]].<ref>{{S|Captivity}}</ref> The name means "Eagle of the West" in [[Quenya]] (from ''[[soron]]''

column1: The translation suggests a connection with the constellation we know today as [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aquila_%28constellation%29 Aquila]
column2: but this was never confirmed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]. The constellation now known as Lyra may also be considered
column3: as its former name in Arabic was ''an-nasr al-wāqi‘'' "falling eagle" (giving its name to its main star [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vega Vega]).<ref>Identification with Aquila or possibly Lyra: Cf. for instance [[Kristine Larsen]]
column11: p. 203. In her conclusion on p. 207
